speaker: Graveyard
lines: You push the iron gate and step inside.
Yew trees line the path and darken the light.
Names fade on old stones in the fog.
A bell hangs silent over the path.
Some graves hold flowers; others are bare.
Broken shells crunch under your boots.
You choose where to go first.

choices.text: Seek the groundskeeper's cottage by the wall.
Walk the oldest stones where the dates have rubbed away.
Descend the steps toward the family crypts.
